A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: I must admit I was disappointed in the story line-particularly as relates to Luke's character. Considering killing his apprentice and nephew while he sleeps. Really? That's not Luke\, that's a disregard for the Star Wars canon by Rian Johnson. The juvenile humor was forced and cheapened the experience. There were so many missed opportunities to develop relationships and backstory's from TFA\,. Instead we were given unnecessary diversions from the main story and characters. The whole casino trip was a waste of time\, and the simplistic dispatching of Snoke was silly. Who was Snoke anyway? He couldn't sense betrayal or a lightsaber. Silly. And if all it takes to destroy a First Order Flying Fortress is ramming a cruiser into it\, just use a bot and be done with it. So much opportunity\, squandered.
